TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The second applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant instituted proceedings in the NORP ORG of GPE against the enlistment office , seeking recalculation of his pension .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected the first applicant 's claim as unsubstantiated . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court . In the operative part of its decision ORG stated that the first applicant could challenge the decision before ORG within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant lodged a cassation appeal with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE a judge of ORG ruled that the first applicant 's cassation appeal should be referred to ORG , stating that the latter court was the court of cassation in administrative cases pursuant to LAW .

CARDINAL . In a ruling of CARDINAL DATE a judge of ORG dismissed the first applicant 's cassation appeal as having been lodged out of time . The judge , relying on LAW paragraph CARDINAL of LAW , held that the first applicant 's cassation appeal ought to have been lodged within DATE of the date of the decision of ORG .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the First Vice - President of ORG informed the first applicant that he could resubmit his cassation appeal with a request for an extension of the expired time - limit .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant resubmitted his cassation appeal to ORG .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the first applicant received a letter from ORG , enclosing a copy of a ruling dated DATE . By that ruling , ORG declined jurisdiction to consider the first applicant 's cassation appeal on the grounds that the case had been determined by ORG under the rules of civil procedure subsequent to the entry into force of LAW on DATE , and thus that ORG was the court of cassation for the first applicant 's case .
CARDINAL . The rulings of DATE and DATE and DATE each stated that they were final and not subject to appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against his former employer , ORG , seeking recovery of salary arrears .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected the second applicant 's claim , doing so partly on the basis that it found the claim to be unsubstantiated and partly as having been lodged out of time . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of the first - instance court . In the operative part of its decision ORG stated that its decision could be appealed against to ORG by way of a cassation appeal within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant lodged a cassation appeal with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE a judge of ORG dismissed the second applicant 's cassation appeal , holding that it was to be considered by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant submitted his cassation appeal to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE a judge of ORG found that the appeal fell to be dealt with by ORG , as the case had been considered by the lower courts under the rules of civil procedure after the entry into force of LAW on DATE . The judge ruled that the cassation appeal was to be returned to the second applicant , together with an explanation of the right to lodge a cassation appeal with ORG . The ruling was final and not subject to appeal .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW read as follows :
“ In GPE the system of courts of general jurisdiction is formed in accordance with the principles of territoriality and specialisation .
ORG is the highest judicial body in the [ hierarchy ] of courts of general jurisdiction .
The respective higher courts are the higher judicial bodies of specialised courts .
Courts of appeal and local courts shall operate in accordance with the law .
The creation of extraordinary and special courts shall not be permitted . ”
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant provisions of LAW of DATE , as worded at the material time , read as follows :

“ ... Legislation on civil court procedure shall establish procedures for the consideration of cases concerning disputes arising from legal relations in the civil , family , labour and collective farming spheres , cases concerning administrative legal relations ... ”
“ The court of cassation instance is ORG of GPE . ”

“ The parties and other persons taking part in the case ... have the right to challenge in cassation judgments and rulings adopted by a first - instance court which have been considered by a court of appeal , as well as rulings and judgments of the court of appeal .
The grounds for [ an appeal ] in cassation are the wrongful application by the court of norms of substantive law or a violation of norms of procedural law . ”
“ The question of referral ... shall be decided by a court composed of CARDINAL judges ...
In the absence of grounds for referral ... the court shall adopt a ruling dismissing the appeal .
This ruling ... shall not be subject to appeal .
If the court has dismissed the cassation appeal , the case shall be returned to the court of first instance ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW , as worded at the material time , read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . The courts shall consider , within the framework of civil court procedure , cases ... concerning legal relations in the civil , housing , land , family and labour spheres , as well as other legal relations , provided they do not fall to be considered under the rules of a different type of court procedure ... ”
“ CARDINAL . The court of cassation instance in civil cases is the court which is envisaged by LAW as the court of cassation in such cases . ”
“ CARDINAL . The parties and other persons taking part in the case ... have the right to challenge in cassation :

( CARDINAL ) judgments of the court of first instance after they have been reviewed on appeal , judgments and rulings of the appeal court adopted [ in the course of ] the consideration [ of the case ] on appeal ...
CARDINAL . The grounds for [ an appeal ] in cassation are the wrongful application by the court of norms of substantive law or a violation of norms of procedural law . ”
CARDINAL . NORP The reporting judge shall refuse to open cassation proceedings if :
( CARDINAL ) the case does not fall to be examined in cassation within the framework of civil procedure ...

CARDINAL . A copy of the ruling ... refusing to open cassation proceedings , together with the materials annexed to the appeal , shall be forwarded to the appellant , and the cassation appeal shall remain with the court of cassation . ”
CARDINAL . Claims and complaints in cases concerning administrative [ matters ] ... lodged before the entry into force of this Code ... shall be considered pursuant to [ the rules of ] LAW ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW DATE , as worded at the material time , read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . NORP The administrative courts shall enjoy jurisdiction over :
( CARDINAL ) disputes between physical persons or legal entities and subjects vested with public powers concerning the latter 's decisions ... actions or lack of action ;
( CARDINAL ) NORP disputes relating to the recruitment , careers and termination of public service of citizens ... ”
CARDINAL . The Higher Administrative Court of GPE shall review in cassation the judicial decisions of local administrative courts and administrative courts of appeal ... ”
“ CARDINAL . The court of cassation instance in administrative cases is ORG of GPE . ”

“ CARDINAL . The parties and other persons taking part in the case ... have the right to challenge in cassation judicial decisions of the court of first instance after they have been reviewed on appeal , as well as judicial decisions of the court of appeal in full or in part ...
CARDINAL . A violation by a court of norms of substantive or procedural law shall constitute a ground for [ an appeal ] in cassation . ”
CARDINAL . The reporting judge shall refuse to open cassation proceedings in the case if :
( CARDINAL ) the case does not fall to be examined in cassation within the framework of administrative procedure ...

CARDINAL . A copy of the ruling ... refusing to open cassation proceedings , together with the materials annexed to the appeal , shall be forwarded to the appellant , while the cassation appeal shall remain with the court of cassation . ”

“ CARDINAL . NORP Parties ... may challenge , in the light of exceptional circumstances , court decisions in administrative cases after their review in cassation and decisions of the court of cassation before ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . Decisions of ORG of GPE in administrative cases may also be challenged in the light of exceptional circumstances [ on the basis ] set out in subparagraph CARDINAL of Article CARDINAL of this Code .
“ CARDINAL . Court decisions in administrative cases may be reviewed in the light of exceptional circumstances by ORG , if they are challenged on the [ following ] grounds :
( CARDINAL ) NORP dissimilar application of the same provision of law by courts of cassation instance ;
( CARDINAL ) a finding by an international judicial body that the courts ' decisions [ in a case ] are infringing GPE 's international obligations . ”
“ CARDINAL . An appeal shall be lodged within DATE of the discovery of the circumstances capable of serving as grounds for [ appeal ] in the light of exceptional circumstances .
CARDINAL . An appeal lodged after the expiry of [ that ] term ... shall be left without consideration , if , upon a request by the appellant , ORG of GPE finds no grounds to renew [ the term ] ... ”

“ CARDINAL . A panel of CARDINAL judges of the judicial chamber of ORG dealing with administrative cases ... shall decide on the admissibility of an appeal made in the light of exceptional circumstances within DATE of its receipt and without summoning the persons taking part in the case . At the same time , [ the panel ] may decide on [ the question of ] the extension of the term for lodging an appeal made in the light of exceptional circumstances .
CARDINAL . An appeal shall be considered admissible ... if CARDINAL judges have reached [ such a conclusion ] .
“ CARDINAL . ... [ A ] panel of judges ... shall adopt , by a majority vote , CARDINAL of the following decisions ...
( CARDINAL ) allowing the appeal in full or in part ;
( CARDINAL ) dismissing the appeal .

CARDINAL . NORP The decision of ORG of GPE [ concerning an appeal made in the light of exceptional circumstances ] is final and may not be appealed against , save for in the circumstances envisaged by LAW paragraph CARDINAL of this Code . ”
“ CARDINAL . ORG of GPE shall allow an appeal if it discovers a dissimilar application of the same provision of law by courts of cassation instance .

CARDINAL . NORP If ORG of GPE establishes that the contested court decision is unlawful , it shall quash it in full or in part and remit the case for fresh consideration to the court of first , appeal or cassation instance , as appropriate , depending on which court was the first to infringe a provision of substantive or procedural law resulting in the incorrect determination of the case . ORG of GPE may also quash decisions of courts of appeal or cassation and leave wrongfully quashed decisions of courts of first or appeal instance in force .
CARDINAL . NORP The decision of ORG of GPE allowing an appeal shall be reasoned . ”
“ CARDINAL . This Code shall enter into force as from DATE ...

CARDINAL . NORP Before the district administrative courts and administrative courts of appeal start to operate , cases falling within their jurisdiction shall be decided by the respective local and appeal courts of general jurisdiction ... pursuant to the rules of LAW GPE ...

CARDINAL . After the entry into force of this Code , claims and complaints in cases concerning administrative [ matters ] ... as well as appeals and appeals in cassation ... in such cases , which were lodged , but not determined , before the entry into force of LAW GPE , shall be considered pursuant to [ the rules of ] this Code .

Such claims or complaints ... may not be left without further action or returned pursuant to this LAW , if they were lodged in compliance with the relevant requirements and jurisdictional rules established by LAW GPE of DATE ...

CARDINAL . Appeals in cassation against judgments of the courts of first instance in the situations envisaged in paragraph CARDINAL of this LAW which were lodged before the entry into force of this LAW and which have not been considered by ORG of GPE shall be referred to ORG of GPE ... ”
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant provisions of LAW of DATE , as worded at the material time , read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . ORG of GPE is the highest judicial body within the [ hierarchy ] of courts of general jurisdiction ...
CARDINAL . ORG of GPE :
( CARDINAL ) ... shall consider cases in cassation in the situations envisaged by law ... ”

( CARDINAL ) ... The chamber of ORG of GPE which hears civil cases shall consider civil cases in cassation until such time as another court [ vested with functions ] of a court of cassation in civil cases is determined by legislation . ”

CARDINAL . Relevant extracts from ORG on the PERSON on the Judicial System and the Status of Judges of GPE by ORG and ORG - operation within ORG , adopted by ORG at its CARDINALth Plenary Session ( GPE , DATE ) , read , in so far as relevant , as follows ( emphasis added in the original text ) :
“ CARDINAL . ORG

CARDINAL . ... [ T]hree different orders of jurisdiction , topped by CARDINAL courts of cassation that are independent of each other , may well lead to numerous and often complex conflicts of jurisdiction . The least that one would expect in such a situation , is that there would be an efficient system for the solution of such conflicts , e.g. through a special “ conflicts ” court . ... ORG should fit that purpose ...

CARDINAL . ... [ T]he idea of a supreme court generally interpreting the law in an authoritative way and thus paving the way for a uniform interpretation of the law by all courts , even before contradictions have arisen .
CARDINAL . Conclusion
CARDINAL . ... ORG jurisdiction should ... reflect[s ] its constitutional status as the highest judicial body in the system of courts of general jurisdiction ...
CARDINAL . Recommendations for improvement of the PERSON include inter alia :

CARDINAL . ORG should be allowed to exercise its jurisdiction to resolve conflicts between the high specialised courts also in matters of procedural law and the ORG should be able to decide itself on the admissibility of cases involving a conflict in the interpretation of the law . It should also be made competent to resolve conflicts of jurisdiction between the CARDINAL sorts of jurisdiction ( civil and criminal , commercial and administrative ) .
